segment.source: Learn how to use the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to view your policy settings.
segment.target: Learn how to use the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to view your policy settings.

segment.source: Use the RSoP snap-in to review policy settings (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Use the RSoP snap-in to review policy settings (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Using the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to review policy settings
segment.target: Using the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to review policy settings

segment.source: After you’ve deployed your custom Internet Explorer package to your employees, you can use the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to view your created policy settings.
segment.target: After you’ve deployed your custom Internet Explorer package to your employees, you can use the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to view your created policy settings.

segment.source: The RSoP snap-in is a two-step process.
segment.target: The RSoP snap-in is a two-step process.

segment.source: First, you run the RSoP wizard to determine what information should be viewed.
segment.target: First, you run the RSoP wizard to determine what information should be viewed.

segment.source: Second, you open the specific items in the console window to view the settings.
segment.target: Second, you open the specific items in the console window to view the settings.

segment.source: For complete instructions about how to use RSoP, see Resultant Set of Policy.
segment.target: For complete instructions about how to use RSoP, see Resultant Set of Policy.

segment.source: On the Start screen, type MMC.
segment.target: On the Start screen, type MMC.

segment.source: Click File, and then click Add/Remove Snap-in.
segment.target: Click File, and then click Add/Remove Snap-in.

segment.source: In the Available snap-ins window, go down to the Resultant Set of Policy snap-in option, click Add, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Available snap-ins window, go down to the Resultant Set of Policy snap-in option, click Add, and then click OK.

segment.source: You’re now ready to use the RSoP snap-in from the console.
segment.target: You’re now ready to use the RSoP snap-in from the console.

segment.source: Right-click Resultant Set of Policy and then click Generate RSoP Data.
segment.target: Right-click Resultant Set of Policy and then click Generate RSoP Data.

segment.source: You’ll only need to go through the resulting RSoP Wizard first time you run the snap-in.
segment.target: You’ll only need to go through the resulting RSoP Wizard first time you run the snap-in.

segment.source: Click Next on the Welcome screen.
segment.target: Click Next on the Welcome screen.

segment.source: Under Computer Configuration, click Administrative Templates, click Windows Components, click IE, and then click the feature you want to review the policy settings for.
segment.target: Under Computer Configuration, click Administrative Templates, click Windows Components, click IE, and then click the feature you want to review the policy settings for.
